sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"囚犯，俘虏"之意。
means: prisoner ： 指关入监狱的囚犯，包括战俘，也可作引申用。
captive ： 指战争中抓到的俘虏，也可作引申用。
convict ： 指经判决而在狱中服刑的人。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"判决，宣判"之意。
means: sentence ： 法律用词，指根据罪犯所犯罪行的轻重而宣判处罚。
condemn ： 普通用词，指法院对审理结束的案件做出的定罪判刑。
judge ： 指对案件作出审理判决，但判决内容较笼统，不如sentence和condemn使用广泛。
convict ： 法律用词，指审判后判定有罪，但未作最后判决。
doom ： 书面用词，指郑重他宣判某人有罪。

sentence.Network_en: I have all the evidence necessary to convict this young criminal now.
sentence.Network_cn: 我掌握一切必要的证据来给这个年轻犯人定罪.

sentence.Network_en: It was difficult to convict him of the falsity of his beliefs.
sentence.Network_cn: 难以使他认识到他信仰的虚假性.

sentence.Network_en: The convict was pardoned after serving five years of his sentence.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Latin convict- 'demonstrated, refuted, convicted', from the verb convincere (see convince). The noun is from obsolete convict 'convicted'

entry.def: If someone is convicted of a crime, they are found guilty of that crime in a law court.

example.ex: In 1977 he was convicted of murder and sentenced to life imprisonment...
example.tran: 1977年，他被判谋杀罪名成立，判处终身监禁。

example.ex: There was insufficient evidence to convict him.
example.tran: 没有足够证据给他定罪。

entry.def: A convict is someone who is in prison.

means.word_mean: 1. a person serving a sentence in a jail or prison
2. a person who has been convicted of a criminal offence

sentences.sentence: "The man was convicted of fraud and sentenced"

auth_sentence.content: Do not expect to be treated like a convict.
auth_sentence.res_content: Do not expect to be treated like a convict.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Do not expect to be treated like a convict.

auth_sentence.content: But magistrates have yet to convict anyone of this crime.
auth_sentence.res_content: But magistrates have yet to convict anyone of this crime.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But magistrates have yet to convict anyone of this crime.

auth_sentence.content: You convict yourself with your own words.
auth_sentence.res_content: You convict yourself with your own words.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You convict yourself with your own words.

stems_affixes.word_buile: con全部+vict征服,克服→彻底征服掉[的人]→证明…有罪;囚犯
convict[v.[经审讯]证明…有罪,宣判…有罪 n.囚犯]+ion表名词→n.深信,确信;定罪,判罪
evict[v.[依法]驱逐]+ion表名词→n.逐出, 赶出
vict征服,克服+or人→n.得胜者,胜利者
victor[n.得胜者,胜利者]+y状态→n.胜利
con全部+vict征服,克服→彻底征服掉[的人]→证明…有罪;囚犯
e出+vict征服,克服→征服后把别人赶出去→驱逐

Sentence.sentence: Jackson spent five years in prison after a jury wrongly convicted him of raping two women.
At Jackson's trial, although two witnesses testified that Jackson was with them in another location at the times of the crimes, he was convicted anyway

sentences.en: I have all the evidence necessary to convict this young criminal now.
sentences.cn: 我掌握一切必要的证据来给这个年轻犯人定罪。

sentences.en: Two of the convicts have escaped from prison.

jushi.english: I have all the evidence necessary to convict this young criminal now.
jushi.chinese: 我掌握一切必要的证据来给这个年轻犯人定罪。

jushi.english: Nearly one hundred of them were subsequently tried, convicted and imprisoned.
jushi.chinese: 其中近一百人后来受到审讯、判刑和监禁。
